title: Speaking to a General Audience: Activities for an Economics Capstone Course
abstract: Students in the economics capstone course usually complete regression-based projects and learn to write for and speak to their peers.However, students must be able to speak to a general audience, for example, in interviews or the workplace.This paper details a pilot activity implemented in a small class setting.The goal was to help students understand the importance of and improve effectiveness when speaking to a general audience about technical topics.Our takeaway, while not formally tested as an experiment, is that students struggled with this task and need training and practice starting earlier in the curriculum.
